page.title: 05Farming around Belper(3)
page.content: {Broadholme House Farm}has 61 acres rented and the farmer owns 10 acres of Bessalone Wood and 12 acres of grass. They have 80 beef cattle and suckling cows for calves and a milker for the house.They stopped milking in 1978 when churn collection was banned. The farm was built in 1858 and is under a preservation order owing to the unusual roof with a centre well.They grow barley, potatoes,hay and rhubarb. They have rented it for 32 years. {Dunge Farm,}in Broadholme Lane,stocks 21 beef cattle,2 breeding pigs and a dog. The actual farm building used to be a public house which was used by the navvies from the nearby railway. This was in the 1840's and was called {The Plough.}The farmer has lived there for 37 years and formerly grew wheat, oats and barley on his 36 acres,but now there is only grass.
